{"step_by_step_thinking": "Foscarnet is an antiviral medication used to treat herpes viruses. According to the documents, it has several side effects, including electrolyte disturbances such as hypocalcemia and hypokalemia. Hypocalcemia is a condition in which there are lower-than-average levels of calcium in the plasma, and hypokalemia is a condition in which there is a lower-than-average amount of potassium in the blood. However, there is no mention of hypercalcemia or hyperkalemia, which are conditions characterized by higher-than-average levels of calcium and potassium in the blood, respectively.", "answer_choice": "A. Hypercalcemia"}
